data:
1
00:00:16,016 --> 00:00:18,310
First, there was darkness.

2
00:00:19,853 --> 00:00:22,731
Then came the Strangers.

3
00:00:22,731 --> 00:00:25,526
They were a race
as old as time itself.

4
00:00:26,610 --> 00:00:29,279
They had mastered
the ultimate technology--

5
00:00:29,321 --> 00:00:34,576
the ability to alter
physical reality by will alone.

6
00:00:34,618 --> 00:00:37,246
They called this ability
"Tuning."

7
00:00:38,413 --> 00:00:40,290
But they were dying.

8
00:00:40,332 --> 00:00:43,335
Their civilization was
in decline,

9
00:00:43,335 --> 00:00:46,088
and so they abandoned
their world,

10
00:00:46,171 --> 00:00:48,841
seeking a cure
for their own mortality.

11
00:00:50,217 --> 00:00:53,679
Their endless journey brought
them to a small, blue world...

12
00:00:53,720 --> 00:00:55,848
in the farthest corner
of the galaxy.

13
00:00:56,890 --> 00:00:58,350
Our world.

14
00:00:59,393 --> 00:01:01,395
Here, they thought
they had finally found...

15
00:01:01,436 --> 00:01:03,397
what they had been
searching for.

16
00:01:14,199 --> 00:01:17,077
My name is
Dr. Daniel Poe Schreber.

17
00:01:18,078 --> 00:01:19,746
I am just a man.

18
00:01:19,788 --> 00:01:22,583
I help the Strangers
conduct their experiments.

19
00:01:24,126 --> 00:01:26,211
I have betrayed my own kind.

20
00:04:53,627 --> 00:04:55,462
You are confused, aren't you?

21
00:04:55,504 --> 00:04:58,298
Frightened. That's all right.
I can help you.

22
00:04:58,298 --> 00:04:59,967
-Who is this?
-I'm a doctor.

23
00:04:59,967 --> 00:05:02,636
You must listen to me.
You have lost your memory.

24
00:05:02,678 --> 00:05:04,805
There was an experiment.
Something went wrong.

25
00:05:04,847 --> 00:05:07,015
Your memory was erased.
Do you understand me?

26
00:05:07,099 --> 00:05:09,142
No, I don't understand.
What's going on here?

27
00:05:09,184 --> 00:05:11,979
There are people coming for you
as we speak.

28
00:05:12,020 --> 00:05:14,314
Don't let them find you.
Leave now.

29
00:05:15,524 --> 00:05:17,693
Hello? Are you there?

30
00:05:59,860 --> 00:06:02,321
Hey, Mr. Murdoch,
the Automat called.

31
00:06:02,362 --> 00:06:03,864
Said you left your wallet there.

32
00:06:04,907 --> 00:06:08,535
I suggest you retrieve it, since
you only paid for three weeks,

33
00:06:08,577 --> 00:06:10,370
and they was up 10 minutes ago.

34
00:06:12,414 --> 00:06:13,916
I've been here three weeks?

35
00:06:13,916 --> 00:06:17,085
It's right there
in black and white, Mr. Murdoch.

36
00:06:17,127 --> 00:06:19,546
Day and date.

37
00:06:19,588 --> 00:06:22,883
We make our books like we make
our beds, all neat and tidy.

38
00:06:22,925 --> 00:06:25,886
-I'll take care of it later.
-See that you do.

39
00:06:25,969 --> 00:06:28,055
Only thing makes you a guest
in this joint...

40
00:06:28,096 --> 00:06:29,515
is cash on the barrelhead!

41
00:06:47,407 --> 00:06:50,118
House rules.
Three weeks is three weeks.

42
00:06:50,160 --> 00:06:52,704
No days off for good behavior.

43
00:07:03,632 --> 00:07:07,302
Mr. Murdoch, yes?
Where is he?

44
00:07:07,302 --> 00:07:10,764
He just left
not five minutes ago.

45
00:07:12,099 --> 00:07:13,892
Sleep now.

46
00:07:16,478 --> 00:07:20,482
When the rumba rhythm
start to play

47
00:07:20,566 --> 00:07:22,734
Dance with me

48
00:07:22,776 --> 00:07:25,821
Make me sway

49
00:07:25,863 --> 00:07:29,825
Like a lazy ocean hugs the shore

50
00:07:29,867 --> 00:07:32,077
Hold me close

51
00:07:32,119 --> 00:07:34,997
Sway me more

52
00:07:34,997 --> 00:07:39,293
Like a flower bending
in the breeze

53
00:07:39,334 --> 00:07:41,795
Bend with me

54
00:07:41,795 --> 00:07:44,631
Sway with ease

55
00:07:44,673 --> 00:07:48,677
When we dance,
you have a way with me

56
00:07:48,677 --> 00:07:51,138
Stay with me

57
00:07:51,138 --> 00:07:53,682
Sway with me

58
00:07:54,474 --> 00:07:58,520
Hey, sweetie, he said he was
your husband's doctor.

59
00:07:58,604 --> 00:08:00,147
He wanted to speak with you.

60
00:08:20,375 --> 00:08:21,668
Excuse me.

61
00:08:23,587 --> 00:08:25,172
-Doctor...
-Schreber.

62
00:08:25,214 --> 00:08:29,218
Please, won't you come in?
You must be Emma Murdoch.

63
00:08:30,552 --> 00:08:34,014
Thank you for coming to see me
on such short notice.

64
00:08:34,056 --> 00:08:35,474
What is this?

65
00:08:35,516 --> 00:08:39,061
A rather crude experiment
designed to further my studies.

66
00:08:39,144 --> 00:08:42,814
I don't understand. You say
you're my husband's doctor,

67
00:08:42,856 --> 00:08:45,400
but he never
mentioned you to me.

68
00:08:45,442 --> 00:08:48,237
The truth is Mrs Murdoch, John has been
coming to see me...

69
00:08:48,278 --> 00:08:49,738
for quite some time.

70
00:08:49,738 --> 00:08:53,116
He had been grappling
with feelings of betrayal...

71
00:08:53,158 --> 00:08:56,203
stemming from
your marital difficulties.

72
00:08:56,245 --> 00:08:58,163
-John told you what happened.
-Yes.

73
00:08:59,540 --> 00:09:01,875
When was the last time
that you saw him?

74
00:09:01,875 --> 00:09:04,753
Three weeks ago.
He packed a suitcase.

75
00:09:04,795 --> 00:09:07,297
He was very angry at me.

76
00:09:07,381 --> 00:09:10,217
I understand how difficult
this must be for you,

77
00:09:10,259 --> 00:09:11,593
but for John's sake,

78
00:09:11,593 --> 00:09:14,596
I would like you to think of me
as your friend, Emma.

79
00:09:14,596 --> 00:09:18,225
It appears that John
has suffered a psychotic break.

80
00:09:18,225 --> 00:09:21,395
-Complete memory loss.
-You can't be serious.

81
00:09:21,436 --> 00:09:24,398
Oh, but I am.
He may be delusional.

82
00:09:24,439 --> 00:09:25,732
Even violent.

83
00:09:27,067 --> 00:09:31,029
If he were to contact you,
you must call me immediately.

84
00:09:31,071 --> 00:09:33,532
Wherever your husband is,
he is searching...

85
00:09:35,284 --> 00:09:36,493
For himself.

86
00:09:46,670 --> 00:09:50,591
Good evening, Mr. Murdoch.
It is Mr. Murdoch, isn't it?

87
00:09:51,508 --> 00:09:54,970
Mr. "J" something Murdoch?

88
00:09:58,307 --> 00:10:02,477
J. Murdoch. What's your name?
Justin? Jerry?

89
00:10:06,815 --> 00:10:08,901
My name's Jason Murdoch.
John Murdoch.

90
00:10:08,942 --> 00:10:11,528
Jake Murdoch. How's it going?
Hi. Jack Murdoch.

91
00:10:17,868 --> 00:10:19,620
Got to get a grip on myself.

92
00:10:43,685 --> 00:10:47,105
I told the guy,
cash on the barrelhead.

93
00:10:47,147 --> 00:10:50,442
I said, "Listen,
three weeks is three weeks."

94
00:10:50,484 --> 00:10:54,071
-Where's our lucky winner?
-Upstairs, sir. Room 614.

95
00:10:55,322 --> 00:10:56,657
The call girl.

96
00:11:01,286 --> 00:11:04,206
-Evening, Husselbeck.
-Inspector Bumstead.

97
00:11:04,206 --> 00:11:05,958
Your lace is untied.

98
00:11:07,209 --> 00:11:08,502
Sorry.

99
00:11:16,885 --> 00:11:18,512
Am I glad you're here, sir.

100
00:11:18,554 --> 00:11:21,181
They say Detective Walenski's
got the heebie-jeebies.

101
00:11:21,223 --> 00:11:23,392
Just take what they give me,
Husselbeck.

102
00:11:54,256 --> 00:11:56,800
-Thanks a lot.
-Excuse me.

103
00:11:59,261 --> 00:12:01,054
-Hello?
-Oh, it's you.

104
00:12:01,763 --> 00:12:04,433
-You left your wallet here buddy.
-When did I do that?

105
00:12:04,474 --> 00:12:06,727
-When you was last here.
-When was that?

106
00:12:06,768 --> 00:12:10,105
When you left your wallet.
Expect me to remember?

107
00:12:15,944 --> 00:12:18,697
-Excuse me!
-No, no, seriously.

108
00:12:36,089 --> 00:12:37,925
-Where you headed, chief?
-Home.

109
00:12:37,966 --> 00:12:39,301
And where's home?

110
00:12:39,301 --> 00:12:42,137
Haven't you mugs got
anything better to do?

111
00:12:42,137 --> 00:12:44,431
Wll I'm just trying to do my job, May.

112
00:12:44,473 --> 00:12:46,475
There's a killer out there in case you didnt noticed.

113
00:12:46,517 --> 00:12:49,186
Maybe you should be out looking for him
instead of cooling your heels.

114
00:12:52,481 --> 00:12:54,233
Go on. Get out of here.

115
00:13:03,158 --> 00:13:04,243
Come on.

116
00:13:07,496 --> 00:13:10,290
What's that make so far?
Six hookers in all?

117
00:13:10,290 --> 00:13:13,210
-I believe so, sir.
-Give the man an "A" for effort.

118
00:13:18,632 --> 00:13:20,968
So, Husselbeck,

119
00:13:21,009 --> 00:13:27,474
what kind of killer do you think
stops to save a dying fish?

120
00:13:27,516 --> 00:13:29,393
-Got me, sir.
-Bumstead.

121
00:13:29,393 --> 00:13:32,729
What took you? This killer's
been running circles around us,

122
00:13:32,729 --> 00:13:33,856
thanks to Walenski.

123
00:13:33,897 --> 00:13:35,649
With all due respect,
Chief lnspector,

124
00:13:35,691 --> 00:13:38,777
I've known Eddie a long time,
and he's a good cop.

125
00:13:38,819 --> 00:13:41,029
Whatever kind of cop
Walenski once was...

126
00:13:41,071 --> 00:13:42,990
he let drift a long time ago.

127
00:13:43,031 --> 00:13:44,825
Let me talk to Bumstead!

128
00:13:44,867 --> 00:13:46,910
Come on! Hold on!

129
00:13:47,578 --> 00:13:48,745
Frank!

130
00:13:51,832 --> 00:13:53,876
-Get his arm !
-They're watching us!

131
00:13:53,917 --> 00:13:56,170
-On your feet!
-There's no way out!

132
00:13:57,588 --> 00:13:59,339
God, can't you see?

133
00:14:02,718 --> 00:14:05,053
Let me go!
I'm not going to hurt you.

134
00:14:06,597 --> 00:14:08,849
-What was that?
-Walenski.

135
00:14:17,191 --> 00:14:20,319
I'm being punished
for my sins, right?

136
00:14:20,360 --> 00:14:24,698
What did I ever do to inherit
this? Where do you begin?

137
00:14:24,698 --> 00:14:27,659
Well, everything Detective
Walenski committed to paper...

138
00:14:27,701 --> 00:14:29,119
should be here, so--

139
00:14:29,161 --> 00:14:31,788
The only thing that should be
committed is Walenski.

140
00:14:34,082 --> 00:14:35,959
Nothing like
a little healthy paranoia.

141
00:14:42,549 --> 00:14:45,886
I came here to file a missing
persons report for my husband.

142
00:14:45,928 --> 00:14:49,306
-Take it to the front desk.
-They told me to come see you.

143
00:14:51,600 --> 00:14:53,268
His name's John Murdoch.

144
00:14:56,313 --> 00:14:59,650
Do these names mean
anything to you?

145
00:15:00,484 --> 00:15:02,444
Who are these women?

146
00:15:02,486 --> 00:15:04,363
Why are you looking
for my husband?

147
00:15:04,404 --> 00:15:06,657
Are you going to accuse him
of something?

148
00:15:06,698 --> 00:15:10,244
-Maybe. Maybe murder.
-Whose murder?

149
00:15:11,662 --> 00:15:14,915
-Which one?
-All of them.

150
00:15:16,333 --> 00:15:19,628
Mrs. Murdoch, I am sorry.
I didn't mean to alarm you.

151
00:15:19,670 --> 00:15:22,422
I'm sorry that I came.
I just made a mistake.

152
00:15:22,464 --> 00:15:26,260
If you'd please just give me
half a second to explain.

153
00:15:35,644 --> 00:15:36,854
We met before?

154
00:15:38,522 --> 00:15:41,608
If we did,
I hope you're still breathing.

155
00:15:41,650 --> 00:15:43,193
What's your name, honey?

156
00:15:46,947 --> 00:15:48,740
Well, that's
an appropriate name.

157
00:15:56,665 --> 00:15:57,958
I was just thinking.

158
00:16:02,171 --> 00:16:03,797
What you do...

159
00:16:04,965 --> 00:16:10,012
It seems kind of dangerous...
right now.

160
00:16:10,053 --> 00:16:12,014
I mean how do you know
I'm not the killer?

161
00:16:12,014 --> 00:16:15,309
You don't seem like
the killer type. Why?

162
00:16:16,226 --> 00:16:18,478
You feeling any urges
I should know about?

163
00:16:30,532 --> 00:16:31,700
Shoot.

164
00:17:19,373 --> 00:17:23,210
So it seems you've discovered
your unpleasant nature.

165
00:17:23,252 --> 00:17:27,047
-Who are you?
-We might ask the same question yes.

166
00:17:28,048 --> 00:17:30,300
Sleep...now.

167
00:17:55,826 --> 00:17:57,035
He can Tune!

168
00:18:50,214 --> 00:18:53,383
What is to be done?
This man is dangerous.

169
00:18:53,467 --> 00:18:56,553
-It is said he is able to Tune.
-Impossible!

170
00:18:56,637 --> 00:18:59,681
We have seen it
with our own eyes.

171
00:18:59,681 --> 00:19:02,559
On occasion, the imprinting
does not take.

172
00:19:02,559 --> 00:19:05,145
They behave erratically
when they awaken.

173
00:19:05,187 --> 00:19:08,857
We find them wandering
like lost children.

174
00:19:08,899 --> 00:19:11,026
But this one was different, yes?

175
00:19:11,068 --> 00:19:14,821
-What has the doctor to say about this?
-He has failed to report in.

176
00:19:14,863 --> 00:19:17,950
-And Mr. Quick?
-No more Mr. Quick.

177
00:19:17,991 --> 00:19:20,619
Mr. Quick...dead, yes.

178
00:19:23,997 --> 00:19:26,667
Poor, poor Mr. Quick.

179
00:19:26,667 --> 00:19:29,586
Mr. Book...does he know?

180
00:19:30,587 --> 00:19:32,673
Should we not know, Mr. Hand?

181
00:19:33,674 --> 00:19:36,552
We had hoped to learn more
before sharing with you.

182
00:19:36,593 --> 00:19:39,555
We can know nothing
until we possess him.

183
00:19:39,555 --> 00:19:41,849
We must have this man.

184
00:19:47,771 --> 00:19:48,939
My brand, I hope.

185
00:20:01,243 --> 00:20:02,828
I've been soo worried about you.

186
00:20:06,874 --> 00:20:08,208
Are you punishing me?

187
00:20:08,959 --> 00:20:11,587
If disappearing is
your way of punishing me,

188
00:20:11,628 --> 00:20:12,880
I don't appreciate it.

189
00:20:12,880 --> 00:20:14,047
I don't what are you talking about?

190
00:20:17,593 --> 00:20:21,388
I found these keys in my pocket,
so I assume I live here.

191
00:20:23,557 --> 00:20:25,893
-You supposed to be my wife?
-"Supposed to be"?

192
00:20:29,438 --> 00:20:33,442
You really...don't know
who I am, do you.

193
00:20:34,318 --> 00:20:37,112
Your doctor called me. He was
worried that this might happen.

194
00:20:37,112 --> 00:20:38,447
My doctor?

195
00:20:41,366 --> 00:20:45,037
He gave me his card.
He's desperate to find you.

196
00:20:52,794 --> 00:20:54,796
Feel like I'm living out
someone else's nightmare.

197
00:20:54,838 --> 00:20:57,633
What happened to me?
Why was I seeing a doctor?

198
00:20:58,258 --> 00:20:59,760
I had an affair.

199
00:21:01,637 --> 00:21:02,971
You were angry at me.

200
00:21:06,141 --> 00:21:09,853
Closing time.
The pool is now closed.

201
00:21:19,571 --> 00:21:21,907
Most unfortunate it is...

202
00:21:21,949 --> 00:21:24,243
that we were forced
to seek you out here.

203
00:21:25,202 --> 00:21:29,331
You know how uncomfortable
we find all this moisture.

204
00:21:30,207 --> 00:21:33,502
-I'm sorry. I--
-Failed to report in, yes?

205
00:21:33,544 --> 00:21:36,505
I was frightened.
I have a weak heart, you know.

206
00:21:36,505 --> 00:21:40,050
Your weakness is not, we think,
an affair of the heart.

207
00:21:40,133 --> 00:21:42,803
We found this in his hotel room.

208
00:21:42,845 --> 00:21:46,348
Must we reproduce
Mr. Murdoch's memories again?

209
00:21:46,348 --> 00:21:48,517
I tried to reprint him,
but he woke up.

210
00:21:48,559 --> 00:21:50,727
He knocked the syringe
right out of my hand.

211
00:21:50,811 --> 00:21:54,022
-He has no memories, then?
-Only fragments.

212
00:21:54,022 --> 00:21:55,566
The procedure,
it was interrupted.

213
00:21:55,566 --> 00:21:58,318
I guess it's only a matter
of rounding him up.

214
00:21:59,069 --> 00:22:00,779
You have had strays
before, right?

215
00:22:00,821 --> 00:22:04,700
This is no stray, Doctor.
This one can Tune.

216
00:22:04,700 --> 00:22:07,786
But that's impossible.
Only you have that ability.

217
00:22:07,828 --> 00:22:10,080
You will process
another template...

218
00:22:10,122 --> 00:22:12,165
of the subject's memories, yes?

219
00:22:12,207 --> 00:22:13,834
Of course.
I'll imprint him again.

220
00:22:15,377 --> 00:22:18,672
We require them
for a quite different purpose.

221
00:22:18,672 --> 00:22:21,508
It's almost midnight,
Dr. Schreber.

222
00:22:21,508 --> 00:22:23,385
We'll talk again
after tonight's Tuning,

223
00:22:23,385 --> 00:22:26,346
but no more delays, yes?

224
00:22:26,388 --> 00:22:31,185
No more inconsistencies
in your behavior.

225
00:22:33,061 --> 00:22:34,730
The police were looking for you.

226
00:22:34,730 --> 00:22:36,899
I know. I saw the papers.

227
00:22:36,940 --> 00:22:39,443
"Killer stalks
city street-walkers."

228
00:22:43,071 --> 00:22:45,365
I was with one of those women.

229
00:22:46,909 --> 00:22:50,329
-Before I came here tonight.
-I don't understand.

230
00:22:50,370 --> 00:22:55,250
I met her outside an Automat.
I guess I wanted to test myself.

231
00:22:56,960 --> 00:23:00,380
I wanted to know if I had it
in me to do those things.

232
00:23:00,380 --> 00:23:01,882
Maybe I have lost my mind,

233
00:23:01,924 --> 00:23:04,927
but whoever I am, I'm still me,
and I'm not a killer.

234
00:23:10,933 --> 00:23:12,309
I believe you.

235
00:23:14,144 --> 00:23:15,395
You do?

236
00:23:19,942 --> 00:23:21,944
-What?
-The car outside.

237
00:23:21,985 --> 00:23:23,445
The one you arrived in.

238
00:23:23,487 --> 00:23:25,781
It's a cop.
He dropped me off here.

239
00:23:27,950 --> 00:23:29,701
I didn't know he was still here.

240
00:23:33,288 --> 00:23:34,706
Hold it right there, mister!

241
00:23:37,125 --> 00:23:40,128
-Wait. You have the wrong man.
-Stand aside, will you, please?

242
00:23:40,170 --> 00:23:41,630
I didn't kill anyone.

243
00:23:41,672 --> 00:23:43,966
Right now,
all you are is a suspect.

244
00:23:44,007 --> 00:23:47,261
Turn yourself in. I'll listen
to whatever you have to say.

245
00:23:47,302 --> 00:23:49,346
You won't believe
what I have to say.

246
00:23:50,472 --> 00:23:53,809
-Try me.
-There's someone after me.

247
00:23:53,809 --> 00:23:57,479
It's this group of men.
They want me dead.

248
00:23:57,479 --> 00:24:00,357
And I don't even know if...
they're not even--

249
00:24:00,357 --> 00:24:02,609
Yeah, who's going to listen
to a madman?

250
00:24:02,651 --> 00:24:05,153
-Stand aside, Mrs. Murdoch.
-Run!

251
00:24:09,491 --> 00:24:11,451
No one ever listens to me.

252
00:24:17,708 --> 00:24:18,792
Murdoch, stop!

253
00:25:01,668 --> 00:25:04,004
-How much further?
-We're almost there, buddy.

254
00:25:07,508 --> 00:25:09,885
You happen to know
the way to Shell Beach?

255
00:25:09,927 --> 00:25:13,013
You're kidding! Me and the wife
spent our honeymoon there.

256
00:25:13,055 --> 00:25:15,557
All you do is
take Main Street West to...

257
00:25:18,560 --> 00:25:21,772
Or is it the Cross...
Now, that's funny.

258
00:25:21,855 --> 00:25:24,942
I can't seem to remember
if it's Main Street West...

259
00:25:25,025 --> 00:25:26,318
or the Crosstown.

260
00:25:30,989 --> 00:25:34,034
I'm sorry, lnspector,
I cannot be of more assistance,

261
00:25:34,117 --> 00:25:36,078
but I am running late
for an appointment.

262
00:25:36,119 --> 00:25:38,247
Well, I appreciate you
taking the time.

263
00:25:46,922 --> 00:25:49,383
There's just one thing
that puzzles me.

264
00:25:49,383 --> 00:25:53,929
I've met quite a few murderers
in the course of my work.

265
00:25:53,971 --> 00:25:56,723
Murdoch doesn't
strike me as one.

266
00:25:56,765 --> 00:25:59,935
Perhaps you are not accustomed
to digging deep enough.

267
00:25:59,977 --> 00:26:02,813
Well, I do know when
someone is lying to me, Doctor.

268
00:26:02,896 --> 00:26:07,109
Inspector, judging personalities
happens to be my business.

269
00:26:07,109 --> 00:26:09,111
Maybe you can give me
a few pointers.

270
00:26:09,152 --> 00:26:13,115
Certainly.
Let's take you, for instance.

271
00:26:13,156 --> 00:26:16,243
You are a fastidious man.
Driven.

272
00:26:16,326 --> 00:26:18,579
Consumed by details.

273
00:26:18,620 --> 00:26:22,124
I would say
your life is rather lonely.

274
00:26:22,165 --> 00:26:24,793
Good evening, lnspector.
I really must be going.

275
00:27:02,539 --> 00:27:03,624
Come in.

276
00:27:08,629 --> 00:27:10,380
-How is he?
-The same.

277
00:27:11,673 --> 00:27:14,343
Walenski? It's me, Frank.

278
00:27:20,682 --> 00:27:21,892
Come in, Frank.

279
00:27:25,187 --> 00:27:26,396
Close the door.

280
00:27:34,446 --> 00:27:37,741
I've been looking through
some of your old reports.

281
00:27:37,783 --> 00:27:39,868
It's an interesting case.

282
00:27:40,994 --> 00:27:44,206
Kind that make a man's career.

283
00:27:45,916 --> 00:27:49,545
-Or break it.
-Yeah. I was on that case.

284
00:27:49,586 --> 00:27:53,382
And then what?
What happened then, Eddie?

285
00:27:53,423 --> 00:27:54,842
Nothing happened, Frank.

286
00:27:55,884 --> 00:27:57,886
I've just been spending time
in the subway,

287
00:27:57,928 --> 00:27:59,888
riding in circles.

288
00:27:59,888 --> 00:28:03,433
Thinking in circles.
There's no way out.

289
00:28:05,727 --> 00:28:07,396
I've been over this entire city.

290
00:28:11,900 --> 00:28:13,777
You're scaring your wife
to death, Eddie.

291
00:28:13,819 --> 00:28:15,320
She's not my wife.

292
00:28:17,155 --> 00:28:20,117
I don't know who she is
or who any of us are.

293
00:28:20,158 --> 00:28:23,537
-What makes you say that?
-You think about the past much?

294
00:28:25,581 --> 00:28:27,082
As much as the next guy.

295
00:28:28,083 --> 00:28:30,836
See, I've been trying
to remember things--

296
00:28:30,919 --> 00:28:33,964
clearly remember things
from my past.

297
00:28:34,006 --> 00:28:36,133
But the more
I try to think back,

298
00:28:36,216 --> 00:28:39,219
the more it all starts
to unravel.

299
00:28:39,261 --> 00:28:40,429
None of it seems real.

300
00:28:40,429 --> 00:28:44,600
It's like I've just
been dreaming this life,

301
00:28:44,600 --> 00:28:47,603
and when I finally wake up,
I'll be somebody else,

302
00:28:47,644 --> 00:28:49,646
somebody totally different.

303
00:28:54,026 --> 00:28:56,195
You saw something,
didn't you, Eddie.

304
00:28:57,321 --> 00:28:59,865
Something to do with the case.

305
00:29:00,449 --> 00:29:03,827
There is no case!
There never was!

306
00:29:03,869 --> 00:29:07,789
It's all just a big joke!
It's a joke!

307
00:29:48,830 --> 00:29:50,582
Tonight's requirements are...

308
00:29:50,624 --> 00:29:53,877
12 family photo albums,

309
00:29:53,919 --> 00:29:56,338
nine personal diaries,

310
00:29:56,380 --> 00:29:58,507
17 love letters,

311
00:29:58,549 --> 00:30:00,968
assorted childhood photographs,

312
00:30:01,009 --> 00:30:05,180
requisite false l.D.s
and social security cards.

313
00:30:05,180 --> 00:30:07,516
These do bring back memories.

314
00:30:09,852 --> 00:30:12,145
This one is still warm.

315
00:30:12,896 --> 00:30:14,064
What is it?

316
00:30:14,064 --> 00:30:17,317
The recollections of
a great lover?

317
00:30:17,359 --> 00:30:19,653
A catalogue of conquests?

318
00:30:20,362 --> 00:30:21,864
We will soon find out.

319
00:30:23,156 --> 00:30:24,658
You wouldn't
appreciate that,

320
00:30:24,700 --> 00:30:27,911
would you,
Mr. Whatever-your-name is?

321
00:30:27,953 --> 00:30:32,249
Not the sort of conquest
you would ever understand.

322
00:30:33,041 --> 00:30:34,376
Let's see.

323
00:30:35,627 --> 00:30:38,380
A touch of
unhappy childhood...

324
00:30:44,011 --> 00:30:46,555
A dash of
teenage rebellion...

325
00:30:48,182 --> 00:30:51,268
And last but not least...

326
00:30:51,268 --> 00:30:53,896
a tragic death
in the family.

327
00:30:56,732 --> 00:30:58,400
Mr. Book.

328
00:31:05,407 --> 00:31:08,994
Why does Murdoch not sleep
during the Tuning?

329
00:31:09,036 --> 00:31:13,290
Maybe he's a step up
the evolutionary ladder.

330
00:31:13,332 --> 00:31:14,541
A freak of nature.

331
00:31:14,583 --> 00:31:17,419
He's adapting to survive.
What do you expect?

332
00:31:17,461 --> 00:31:19,421
Weren't you looking for
the human soul?

333
00:31:19,421 --> 00:31:22,090
Isn't that the purpose
of your little zoo?

334
00:31:22,090 --> 00:31:25,469
That's why you change people
and things every night.

335
00:31:25,469 --> 00:31:28,305
Maybe you have finally
found what you are looking for,

336
00:31:28,388 --> 00:31:29,932
and it's going to bite you
on your--

337
00:31:33,977 --> 00:31:35,896
It requires several
of your lifetimes...

338
00:31:35,938 --> 00:31:37,606
to master our gifts.

339
00:31:37,648 --> 00:31:39,441
The idea that
a simple man...

340
00:31:39,483 --> 00:31:41,485
could develop the ability
to Tune is--

341
00:31:41,527 --> 00:31:42,653
Absurd, I know.

342
00:31:42,694 --> 00:31:44,988
What other explanation is there?

343
00:31:49,952 --> 00:31:51,119
It is time.

344
00:32:37,040 --> 00:32:38,500
Shut it down.

345
00:32:57,019 --> 00:33:00,147
Fredrickson says he'll take me
off the night shift.

346
00:33:00,189 --> 00:33:02,024
It's about time, dear.

347
00:33:52,783 --> 00:33:53,784
Hello?

348
00:34:02,084 --> 00:34:03,418
Wake up.

349
00:34:06,588 --> 00:34:08,090
Wake up!

350
00:34:18,100 --> 00:34:20,269
Can anyone hear me?

351
00:34:23,438 --> 00:34:26,275
Let the Tuning commence.

352
00:37:06,143 --> 00:37:07,519
The Goodwins.

353
00:37:07,519 --> 00:37:09,479
Charlie, Sylvia,

354
00:37:09,563 --> 00:37:11,648
Jane, and little Matthew.

355
00:37:15,527 --> 00:37:17,738
Jane and little Matthew.

356
00:37:47,893 --> 00:37:50,187
The rich get richer.

357
00:37:50,229 --> 00:37:52,272
Probably have
maid's quarters...

358
00:37:52,356 --> 00:37:53,690
before the night
is through.

359
00:38:47,244 --> 00:38:49,204
Dr. Schreber, I presume.

360
00:38:49,246 --> 00:38:50,747
It's you.

361
00:38:50,789 --> 00:38:51,832
Hey, come on.

362
00:38:51,874 --> 00:38:54,042
That's no way to greet
a patient, Doctor,

363
00:38:54,042 --> 00:38:56,211
if that's what you are.

364
00:38:56,211 --> 00:38:57,713
Please, l--

365
00:38:57,713 --> 00:38:59,548
Why is everyone asleep?

366
00:38:59,590 --> 00:39:01,967
Please keep your voice down.

367
00:39:02,050 --> 00:39:03,927
I can't remember anything.
What have you done?

368
00:39:03,969 --> 00:39:06,763
Nothing. I want to help you.

369
00:39:06,805 --> 00:39:10,267
We cannot talk here.
If they see us together--

370
00:39:10,309 --> 00:39:13,145
I don't care.
I want some answers. Now!

371
00:39:13,228 --> 00:39:16,315
Who are they?
Why are they trying to kill me?

372
00:39:16,398 --> 00:39:17,441
Answer me!

373
00:39:22,571 --> 00:39:23,614
My God.

374
00:39:23,655 --> 00:39:26,700
-You really can do it.
-I did that?

375
00:39:26,742 --> 00:39:29,369
Listen to me.
You have their power.

376
00:39:29,411 --> 00:39:31,371
You can make things happen
by will alone.

377
00:39:31,413 --> 00:39:32,998
They call it "Tuning."

378
00:39:33,040 --> 00:39:35,000
That is how they change
the buildings.

379
00:39:35,083 --> 00:39:37,586
Just now you acted
out of self-defense,

380
00:39:37,628 --> 00:39:40,422
but I can teach you
to control your power.

381
00:39:40,422 --> 00:39:44,426
We can stop them.
We can take the city back.

382
00:39:47,763 --> 00:39:49,264
My glasses.

383
00:40:43,443 --> 00:40:45,779
He made a terrible impression
for the firm,

384
00:40:45,821 --> 00:40:48,657
Iollygagging around
as he did.

385
00:40:48,699 --> 00:40:51,577
So I told Fredrickson
I was letting him go.

386
00:40:51,618 --> 00:40:53,620
Well you should have, darling.

387
00:40:54,329 --> 00:40:57,416
He attacked me.
I don't know where he's gone.

388
00:40:57,916 --> 00:41:01,879
Come, Dr. Schreber.
We have much to do.

389
00:41:01,920 --> 00:41:04,506
-Yes?
-Yes.

390
00:41:06,925 --> 00:41:13,390
They say that
you're a runaround lover

391
00:41:14,433 --> 00:41:22,524
Though you say it isn't so

392
00:41:25,402 --> 00:41:32,201
But if you put me down
for another

393
00:41:33,827 --> 00:41:39,708
I'll know, believe me, I'll know

394
00:41:41,210 --> 00:41:44,713
Tonight's experiment will
take place in these locations.

395
00:41:44,713 --> 00:41:48,759
The first subject
shall be imprinted on Avenue M.

396
00:41:48,800 --> 00:41:51,803
Mr. Book, there is a problem.

397
00:41:51,887 --> 00:41:53,430
There is no Avenue M.

398
00:41:53,472 --> 00:41:55,390
We were unable
to complete it.

399
00:41:55,432 --> 00:41:58,894
During the last Tuning,
we detected a lack of control.

400
00:41:58,936 --> 00:42:02,147
An opposing influence
on the machines?

401
00:42:02,231 --> 00:42:06,443
This man Murdoch is
more powerful than we thought.

402
00:42:06,485 --> 00:42:08,445
He is becoming like us.

403
00:42:08,445 --> 00:42:11,865
So we must become like him.

404
00:42:12,783 --> 00:42:15,118
The doctor has done as we asked?

405
00:42:15,160 --> 00:42:18,872
The life and times
of John Murdoch, volume two.

406
00:42:20,874 --> 00:42:23,460
We must not do this.

407
00:42:23,502 --> 00:42:26,922
Murdoch does not possess
these memories, yes?

408
00:42:26,922 --> 00:42:29,758
How will his imprint
allow us to find him?

409
00:42:29,800 --> 00:42:33,262
Everywhere he goes,
everyone he seeks out...

410
00:42:33,303 --> 00:42:34,513
will be known to us.

411
00:42:34,596 --> 00:42:39,685
And as he follows the clues,
so shall we follow the memories.

412
00:42:39,768 --> 00:42:42,187
But to imprint one of us?

413
00:42:42,187 --> 00:42:44,940
Failure has always resulted.

414
00:42:44,982 --> 00:42:48,527
What Mr. Hand proposes
is our only option.

415
00:42:48,569 --> 00:42:50,195
Imprint.

416
00:42:55,576 --> 00:42:57,494
This may sting a bit.

417
00:43:34,031 --> 00:43:35,699
Is it done?

418
00:43:35,741 --> 00:43:38,160
Oh, yes, Mr. Book.

419
00:43:38,202 --> 00:43:42,039
I have John Murdoch in mind.

420
00:43:42,706 --> 00:43:44,291
"Johnny...

421
00:43:44,333 --> 00:43:48,337
"Found this postcard
among your mother's things.

422
00:43:48,378 --> 00:43:50,672
"Brings back memories,
doesn't it?

423
00:43:50,672 --> 00:43:52,508
"Stop by sometime.

424
00:43:52,549 --> 00:43:55,886
"We'll see if we can't
hook ourselves another mermaid.

425
00:43:55,886 --> 00:43:58,222
"Love to Emma. Karl."

426
00:44:03,727 --> 00:44:04,686
Karl.

427
00:44:06,563 --> 00:44:08,232
Karl Harris.

428
00:44:16,406 --> 00:44:17,407
Harris.

429
00:44:25,707 --> 00:44:28,752
Excuse me.
Which way is Avenue C?

430
00:44:28,794 --> 00:44:30,045
Try the subway.

431
00:44:33,757 --> 00:44:35,259
You got a problem, pal?

432
00:44:35,300 --> 00:44:38,136
Been working here long?

433
00:44:38,220 --> 00:44:41,557
25 years.
No days off for good behavior.

434
00:45:06,665 --> 00:45:09,585
We're looking for John Murdoch.

435
00:45:43,827 --> 00:45:45,913
She knows nothing,
Mr. Hand.

436
00:45:45,954 --> 00:45:47,789
A dead end, Mr. Wall.

437
00:45:47,831 --> 00:45:50,626
We thought his imprint
would let us track him.

438
00:45:50,626 --> 00:45:53,128
But instead
we have been brought here.

439
00:45:53,170 --> 00:45:57,216
-This is irrational.
-Instincts are irrational.

440
00:45:57,299 --> 00:46:00,552
We must follow
where they lead, yes?

441
00:46:00,636 --> 00:46:03,847
Mr. Sleep suggests he may go
to places familiar.

442
00:46:03,889 --> 00:46:05,224
His job.

443
00:46:05,307 --> 00:46:07,351
He does not care about our job.

444
00:46:07,351 --> 00:46:10,187
Indulge us, Mr. Hand.

445
00:46:10,229 --> 00:46:12,898
If you were Murdoch, yes?

446
00:46:12,898 --> 00:46:16,276
If I were Murdoch...

447
00:46:18,070 --> 00:46:21,573
I would remember how
my wife had hurt me...

448
00:46:21,615 --> 00:46:23,659
by sleeping with another man.

449
00:46:25,202 --> 00:46:26,662
And then...

450
00:46:28,580 --> 00:46:32,000
I would look for a way
to hurt her in return.

451
00:46:35,003 --> 00:46:39,591
Leave me alone with her.
There's work to be done.

452
00:46:43,262 --> 00:46:45,389
All change,
platform three.

453
00:46:48,058 --> 00:46:49,184
All change?

454
00:46:49,226 --> 00:46:51,562
Excuse me, how do I get
to the end of the line?

455
00:46:51,562 --> 00:46:53,063
You want the Express.

456
00:47:05,659 --> 00:47:08,120
How come the train didn't stop?

457
00:47:08,161 --> 00:47:09,413
That's the Express.

458
00:47:10,956 --> 00:47:12,875
There's no way out.

459
00:47:12,916 --> 00:47:15,711
You can't get out of the city.
I've tried.

460
00:47:16,879 --> 00:47:18,922
You're Murdoch, aren't you?

461
00:47:18,964 --> 00:47:20,632
The one
they've been looking for.

462
00:47:20,716 --> 00:47:21,800
You're not a killer.

463
00:47:21,884 --> 00:47:24,595
They set you up with
a fake identity,

464
00:47:24,595 --> 00:47:26,263
Iike everyone else here.

465
00:47:26,263 --> 00:47:28,223
-Who are you?
-I was a cop.

466
00:47:28,265 --> 00:47:31,393
At least in this life I was.

467
00:47:31,435 --> 00:47:34,271
They steal peoples' memories.

468
00:47:34,313 --> 00:47:36,106
Then they swap them around
between us.

469
00:47:36,148 --> 00:47:38,859
I seen them do it,
back and forth...

470
00:47:38,901 --> 00:47:41,028
till no one knows
who they are anymore.

471
00:47:41,069 --> 00:47:42,362
How do you know all this?

472
00:47:42,404 --> 00:47:44,198
Once in a while one of us
wakes up...

473
00:47:44,239 --> 00:47:45,657
while they're changing things.

474
00:47:46,575 --> 00:47:49,077
It's not supposed to happen,
but it does.

475
00:47:49,119 --> 00:47:50,454
It happened to me.

476
00:47:51,121 --> 00:47:52,998
They'll come looking for you.

477
00:47:54,124 --> 00:47:56,460
Just like they'll come
looking for me.

478
00:47:56,502 --> 00:47:57,920
But that's OK.

479
00:47:57,920 --> 00:47:59,171
I figured a way out.

480
00:48:10,641 --> 00:48:11,850
They were here.

481
00:48:13,977 --> 00:48:15,354
Last night.

482
00:48:15,437 --> 00:48:17,648
This was to be his home.

483
00:48:20,317 --> 00:48:22,110
That was when we loved her.

484
00:48:22,152 --> 00:48:24,488
This is all well and good,

485
00:48:24,530 --> 00:48:26,532
but we require
a more practical link...

486
00:48:26,573 --> 00:48:28,617
to his present whereabouts.

487
00:48:33,247 --> 00:48:35,249
And I know where to find her.

488
00:48:43,674 --> 00:48:47,010
We're very lucky,
when you think about it.

489
00:48:47,010 --> 00:48:48,053
I'm sorry?

490
00:48:48,136 --> 00:48:50,180
To be able to revisit
those places...

491
00:48:50,180 --> 00:48:52,182
which meant
so very much to us.

492
00:48:53,016 --> 00:48:55,561
I thought we were haunted
by them.

493
00:48:55,644 --> 00:48:57,354
Perhaps.

494
00:48:57,396 --> 00:48:59,857
There used to be a ferry
when I was a boy.

495
00:48:59,898 --> 00:49:01,984
Biggest thing you ever saw.

496
00:49:02,025 --> 00:49:04,862
Lit up like
a floating birthday cake.

497
00:49:06,238 --> 00:49:08,824
That's just what my husband
once said to me.

498
00:49:08,866 --> 00:49:10,409
On this very spot.

499
00:49:11,910 --> 00:49:13,996
Where is your husband now?

500
00:49:14,037 --> 00:49:17,833
I wish I knew.
What brings you here?

501
00:49:17,833 --> 00:49:20,711
I met my wife at this place.

502
00:49:20,752 --> 00:49:23,005
It's where I met my husband.

503
00:49:23,046 --> 00:49:24,548
Small world.

504
00:50:18,727 --> 00:50:19,728
Hello?

505
00:51:07,067 --> 00:51:08,944
What are you doing here?

506
00:51:08,986 --> 00:51:10,612
I've been following you.

507
00:51:14,533 --> 00:51:16,243
Hold it right there!

508
00:51:18,328 --> 00:51:19,288
Johnny?

509
00:51:22,416 --> 00:51:23,709
It's been so damn long,

510
00:51:23,750 --> 00:51:25,878
I thought you'd forgotten
your Uncle Karl.

511
00:51:27,045 --> 00:51:28,463
You son of a gun!

512
00:51:31,884 --> 00:51:33,135
Uncle Karl...

513
00:51:36,180 --> 00:51:37,181
Wait.

514
00:51:40,058 --> 00:51:42,227
-Is that me?
-Yeah.

515
00:51:50,527 --> 00:51:52,279
Shell Beach is where
I grew up?

516
00:51:52,321 --> 00:51:54,948
That's what I said.
Shell Beach.

517
00:51:54,990 --> 00:51:57,409
-Your home town.
-I need to get there.

518
00:51:57,451 --> 00:51:58,493
How do I get there?

519
00:51:59,912 --> 00:52:02,831
I don't know.
I haven't been there in years.

520
00:52:02,873 --> 00:52:05,751
You must remember.
You must have some idea.

521
00:52:07,711 --> 00:52:08,921
Sorry, Johnny.

522
00:52:10,339 --> 00:52:12,883
The old cracker barrel
ain't what it used to be.

523
00:52:16,720 --> 00:52:20,182
-It was so bright there.
-Brighter times, I guess.

524
00:52:21,934 --> 00:52:25,229
You were always scribbling
in that damn book.

525
00:52:25,270 --> 00:52:27,231
That's me and your Pa.

526
00:52:27,272 --> 00:52:29,608
What a couple of
handsome fools.

527
00:52:29,608 --> 00:52:31,193
What happened to my parents?

528
00:52:33,737 --> 00:52:34,863
Where are they now?

529
00:52:36,114 --> 00:52:37,908
They're dead, Johnny.

530
00:52:37,950 --> 00:52:40,702
They died when the house
burned down.

531
00:52:40,744 --> 00:52:42,371
I looked after you.

532
00:52:43,288 --> 00:52:45,040
You don't remember that,
really?

533
00:52:47,918 --> 00:52:50,420
What's that? What is that?

534
00:52:56,218 --> 00:52:58,095
It's a scar.

535
00:52:58,095 --> 00:53:00,430
You burned your arm pretty bad
in the fire.

536
00:53:05,978 --> 00:53:07,563
What does it mean?

537
00:53:07,604 --> 00:53:09,606
It means these are all lies!

538
00:53:13,694 --> 00:53:16,029
My husband told me
he'd been here.

539
00:53:16,071 --> 00:53:18,866
He told me he wanted
to test himself.

540
00:53:18,907 --> 00:53:21,201
See if he was...

541
00:53:21,243 --> 00:53:23,579
capable of...

542
00:53:32,462 --> 00:53:34,298
I wanted to talk to her.

543
00:53:34,298 --> 00:53:36,258
I thought she could
help me find him.

544
00:53:37,968 --> 00:53:39,970
I'm going to call the station.

545
00:53:56,153 --> 00:53:57,404
It's beautiful.

546
00:54:00,073 --> 00:54:02,910
It was a gift from my mother.

547
00:54:02,951 --> 00:54:04,494
She died recently.

548
00:54:05,871 --> 00:54:08,165
I keep it with me
to remind me of her.

549
00:54:10,334 --> 00:54:11,335
I'm sorry.

550
00:54:15,005 --> 00:54:17,174
It's a funny thing, though.

551
00:54:17,174 --> 00:54:19,635
I can't remember
when she gave it to me.

552
00:54:22,054 --> 00:54:24,515
How do you think I could
forget a thing like that?

553
00:54:26,016 --> 00:54:28,477
What's happening, lnspector?

554
00:54:28,519 --> 00:54:30,312
I'm not sure I know anymore.

555
00:54:34,316 --> 00:54:36,068
I left your old room
like it was.

556
00:54:37,110 --> 00:54:39,363
You can sleep here tonight.

557
00:54:39,404 --> 00:54:41,532
Glad to have you back, Johnny.

558
00:54:41,532 --> 00:54:44,326
-Even if it is for just a night.
-Karl.

559
00:54:45,452 --> 00:54:48,121
-Is that the right time?
-Why, sure.

560
00:54:48,163 --> 00:54:50,582
That clock's kept perfect time
since I bought it.

561
00:54:50,624 --> 00:54:51,959
A.M. or P.M.?

562
00:54:53,627 --> 00:54:56,046
-What do you think?
-I don't understand.

563
00:54:56,046 --> 00:54:58,882
How can it be night already?
What happened to the day?

564
00:54:58,882 --> 00:55:01,385
You're tired.
Anything's possible.

565
00:55:03,053 --> 00:55:04,054
Get some sleep.

566
00:55:04,054 --> 00:55:06,557
We'll straighten all this out
tomorrow.

567
00:55:38,672 --> 00:55:39,923
Come on...

568
00:56:00,319 --> 00:56:03,322
He's here.
He's acting peculiar.

569
00:56:03,363 --> 00:56:05,741
I know. He's not himself.

570
00:56:05,782 --> 00:56:07,826
Keep him there,
and I'll be right over.

571
00:56:07,868 --> 00:56:10,120
-I'll try.
-Thanks. Bye.

572
00:56:13,665 --> 00:56:17,044
I can't promise anything.
We'll play it as it comes.

573
00:56:17,794 --> 00:56:20,631
We just wanted to help.

574
00:56:27,304 --> 00:56:30,974
Karl. Uncle Karl.

575
00:56:30,974 --> 00:56:34,478
If you're in trouble,
maybe we can do something.

576
00:56:35,938 --> 00:56:38,440
Haven't seen you in so long.

577
00:57:53,015 --> 00:57:57,686
Mr. Murdoch, you've been
the cause of much distress.

578
00:58:02,524 --> 00:58:04,902
-Start talking.
-There's no need for this.

579
00:58:04,943 --> 00:58:08,530
There's no escape.
The city's ours. We made it.

580
00:58:08,572 --> 00:58:09,907
What are you talking about?

581
00:58:09,948 --> 00:58:13,035
We fashioned this city
on stolen memories.

582
00:58:13,076 --> 00:58:16,830
Different eras, different pasts,
all rolled into one.

583
00:58:16,872 --> 00:58:20,918
Each night we revise it,
refine it, in order to learn.

584
00:58:20,959 --> 00:58:24,004
-Learn what?
-About you.

585
00:58:24,087 --> 00:58:28,467
You and your fellow inhabitants.
What makes you human.

586
00:58:28,467 --> 00:58:31,970
-Why?
-We need to be like you.

587
00:58:32,804 --> 00:58:34,932
I understand you now.

588
00:58:34,932 --> 00:58:38,560
I remember that which you do
not, what you've been missing.

589
00:58:38,602 --> 00:58:44,107
The ocean, yes? Running along
the waves as a child.

590
00:58:44,149 --> 00:58:48,695
Meeting Emma at the river,
that first kiss that followed.

591
00:58:49,655 --> 00:58:52,783
-What are you?
-You've seen what we are.

592
00:58:52,824 --> 00:58:55,410
We use your dead as vessels.

593
01:01:05,082 --> 01:01:06,083
Get in!

594
01:01:21,598 --> 01:01:25,519
-What about her? Ring a bell?
-She was alive when I left her.

595
01:01:25,519 --> 01:01:28,564
-What about this?
-This is nothing.

596
01:01:28,605 --> 01:01:30,816
It must mean something--
all those pictures.

597
01:01:30,816 --> 01:01:31,859
What pictures?

598
01:01:33,318 --> 01:01:36,196
-I don't understand this.
-Stop playing games with me.

599
01:01:36,238 --> 01:01:38,699
-Stop telling me lies.
-I am not telling lies!

600
01:01:38,740 --> 01:01:41,076
Help me out.
Make me understand.

601
01:01:41,118 --> 01:01:46,081
I have this jigsaw puzzle in
my face, and it makes no sense.

602
01:01:46,123 --> 01:01:49,459
You think it makes sense to me?
I'm as confused as you are.

603
01:01:49,501 --> 01:01:53,463
Let me ask you a question.
Have you heard of Shell Beach?

604
01:01:53,463 --> 01:01:55,632
-Sure.
-You know how to get there?

605
01:01:55,632 --> 01:01:57,342
-Yeah.
-Tell me.

606
01:01:57,885 --> 01:02:03,182
-Right. You just go to the...
-Where? Where do you go?

607
01:02:03,182 --> 01:02:04,850
Give me a second, will you?

608
01:02:06,810 --> 01:02:08,395
You can't remember, can you?

609
01:02:09,771 --> 01:02:12,274
Thinking that's kind of odd?

610
01:02:13,483 --> 01:02:15,569
Wait. I got a better one.

611
01:02:15,611 --> 01:02:19,364
When was the last time you
did something during the day?

612
01:02:19,990 --> 01:02:22,951
-What do you mean?
-I just mean during the day.

613
01:02:24,161 --> 01:02:26,914
Daylight. When was the last
time you remember seeing it?

614
01:02:26,955 --> 01:02:30,667
I'm not talking about a distant,
half-forgotten childhood memory.

615
01:02:30,709 --> 01:02:33,504
I mean, like, yesterday.
Last week? When?

616
01:02:34,421 --> 01:02:36,173
Do you have a single memory?

617
01:02:38,008 --> 01:02:39,718
You don't, do you?

618
01:02:39,718 --> 01:02:45,265
I don't think the sun
even exists in this place.

619
01:02:45,349 --> 01:02:49,520
'Cause I've been up for hours
and hours, and night never ends.

620
01:02:50,103 --> 01:02:52,356
-That's crazy.
-You're damn right it's crazy.

621
01:02:52,397 --> 01:02:55,984
But listen to me, Bumstead.
It's not just me.

622
01:02:56,026 --> 01:02:58,946
It's all of us. They're doing
something to all of us.

623
01:02:58,987 --> 01:03:00,864
Shut up.
I've heard enough.

624
01:03:00,864 --> 01:03:03,617
-Please listen--
-Shut up!

625
01:03:14,044 --> 01:03:16,880
There has to be an explanation.

626
01:03:24,263 --> 01:03:25,222
Explain this.

627
01:03:47,035 --> 01:03:48,537
I'm so sorry.

628
01:03:49,621 --> 01:03:52,583
I never meant to hurt you.
I don't know why I did.

629
01:03:52,583 --> 01:03:54,418
I wish I could take it back.

630
01:03:55,085 --> 01:03:57,421
You didn't do it.

631
01:03:57,421 --> 01:03:59,131
This affair of yours,

632
01:03:59,173 --> 01:04:02,259
whatever you think you've done,
you didn't do it.

633
01:04:02,301 --> 01:04:03,468
I don't believe it happened.

634
01:04:03,510 --> 01:04:07,306
-What do you mean?
-This will sound crazy.

635
01:04:07,347 --> 01:04:10,517
What if we never knew
each other before now?

636
01:04:10,517 --> 01:04:16,773
What if the first time we met
was last night in our apartment?

637
01:04:16,815 --> 01:04:19,526
And everything you remember,

638
01:04:19,568 --> 01:04:22,779
and everything I'm supposed to
remember never really happened.

639
01:04:22,821 --> 01:04:25,282
Someone just wants us
to think it did.

640
01:04:26,241 --> 01:04:27,743
But how can that be true?

641
01:04:28,368 --> 01:04:31,371
I so vividly remember
meeting you.

642
01:04:32,664 --> 01:04:35,042
I remember falling in love
with you.

643
01:04:36,627 --> 01:04:39,630
-I remember losing you.
-Time's up.

644
01:04:41,173 --> 01:04:46,011
No, wait, please.
Just one more minute.

645
01:04:52,518 --> 01:04:54,019
I love you, John.

646
01:04:57,397 --> 01:04:59,566
You can't fake something
like that.

647
01:05:01,235 --> 01:05:02,736
No, you can't.

648
01:05:32,057 --> 01:05:34,601
Inspector? Sir?

649
01:05:36,019 --> 01:05:38,730
Detective Walenski
killed himself last night.

650
01:05:41,066 --> 01:05:42,484
I thought you should know.

651
01:05:45,070 --> 01:05:49,408
The chief wanted to see you.
Sir?

652
01:05:56,331 --> 01:05:58,208
I knew you'd track
the killer down.

653
01:06:13,765 --> 01:06:14,892
Shoelace.

654
01:06:28,030 --> 01:06:31,200
-How can we help you, sir?
-You can sleep.

655
01:06:34,620 --> 01:06:36,330
Sleep. Sleep.

656
01:06:40,083 --> 01:06:41,251
Evening.

657
01:06:54,139 --> 01:06:57,768
I wanted to be the first to
congratulate you about the case.

658
01:07:00,354 --> 01:07:03,190
Take us to Murdoch.

659
01:07:03,190 --> 01:07:04,191
Sleep.

660
01:07:34,680 --> 01:07:36,306
I knew you'd come eventually.

661
01:07:36,348 --> 01:07:38,851
Isn't it time
you gave me some answers?

662
01:07:40,185 --> 01:07:42,896
Yes, of course.
Won't you please sit down?

663
01:07:46,191 --> 01:07:48,068
I come here often.

664
01:07:48,110 --> 01:07:50,654
It's one of the few places
I'm allowed some peace.

665
01:07:51,113 --> 01:07:54,116
You see, they have
an aversion to water.

666
01:07:55,117 --> 01:07:57,119
One could almost call it
a phobia.

667
01:07:57,578 --> 01:08:00,205
Who are they?
What do they want from me?

668
01:08:00,247 --> 01:08:01,248
Right.

669
01:08:01,957 --> 01:08:06,670
For now, let's say you're
the subject of their experiment.

670
01:08:06,712 --> 01:08:08,172
We all are.

671
01:08:09,840 --> 01:08:15,721
I'm sorry, but I have no time
to do this the right way.

672
01:08:15,721 --> 01:08:19,725
Everything you need to know
is in this syringe.

673
01:08:19,766 --> 01:08:23,353
I need you to inject yourself.
It's the only way to understand.

674
01:08:23,395 --> 01:08:26,231
-You're kidding, right?
-We're running out of time!

675
01:08:26,273 --> 01:08:29,902
-You have to do this now.
-Give me the gun.

676
01:08:29,943 --> 01:08:32,112
He's more disturbed
than we thought.

677
01:08:32,154 --> 01:08:34,990
I may not be the judge
of personality you are,

678
01:08:35,032 --> 01:08:37,993
but you're the one
who looks disturbed.

679
01:08:38,035 --> 01:08:40,537
You don't know what
you're doing.

680
01:08:41,747 --> 01:08:45,709
What exactly is in this, Doctor?

681
01:08:47,377 --> 01:08:50,547
All the answers you've been
looking for, I swear to you.

682
01:08:52,466 --> 01:08:58,263
Guess I'll hold on to it for
safekeeping, if you don't mind.

683
01:08:58,263 --> 01:08:59,598
Let's go, Doctor.

684
01:09:01,141 --> 01:09:04,311
Go? Where are we going?

685
01:09:04,770 --> 01:09:06,480
Shell Beach.

686
01:09:07,606 --> 01:09:11,068
That's where you wanted to go,
isn't it, the ocean?

687
01:09:19,868 --> 01:09:23,288
Won't find anything there.
I've been there--

688
01:09:23,330 --> 01:09:25,666
Then you can show us the way.

689
01:09:25,707 --> 01:09:29,419
I won't. I refuse.
You can't make me go there.

690
01:09:29,419 --> 01:09:31,839
Don't you understand?
They'll be waiting for us.

691
01:09:41,139 --> 01:09:45,644
I don't understand.
There used to be a bridge here.

692
01:09:51,024 --> 01:09:54,111
Try that again, and your friends
will find you in the canal.

693
01:09:54,152 --> 01:09:55,946
Don't hurt me.
I'll tell you everything.

694
01:09:55,988 --> 01:09:57,739
It doesn't matter anymore
anyway.

695
01:10:04,580 --> 01:10:05,581
What?

696
01:10:08,959 --> 01:10:10,502
Who are you people?

697
01:10:10,961 --> 01:10:13,714
Must go to the end
of the canal.

698
01:10:15,007 --> 01:10:17,676
We will give you some more
pretty things soon...

699
01:10:18,844 --> 01:10:21,180
-Anna.
-I'm not Anna.

700
01:10:22,848 --> 01:10:24,850
You will be soon, yes.

701
01:10:29,146 --> 01:10:31,982
I have another use
for her first.

702
01:10:41,491 --> 01:10:43,327
I call them Strangers.

703
01:10:43,911 --> 01:10:46,371
They abducted us
and brought us here.

704
01:10:47,539 --> 01:10:52,002
This city, everyone in it...
is their experiment.

705
01:10:52,002 --> 01:10:54,713
They mix and match our memories
as they see fit,

706
01:10:54,755 --> 01:10:57,424
trying to divine
what makes us unique.

707
01:10:57,925 --> 01:11:00,761
One day, a man might be
an inspector.

708
01:11:00,844 --> 01:11:03,597
The next,
someone entirely different.

709
01:11:04,014 --> 01:11:07,434
When they want to study
a murderer, for instance,

710
01:11:07,434 --> 01:11:11,939
they simply imprint one of their
citizens with a new personality.

711
01:11:11,939 --> 01:11:16,235
Arrange a family for him,
friends, an entire history...

712
01:11:16,276 --> 01:11:18,153
even a lost wallet.

713
01:11:18,195 --> 01:11:20,322
Then they observe the results.

714
01:11:21,573 --> 01:11:25,744
Will a man, given the history of
a killer, continue in that vein?

715
01:11:26,203 --> 01:11:29,790
Or are we, in fact, more than
the sum of our memories?

716
01:11:29,831 --> 01:11:34,378
This business of you being
a killer was a sad coincidence.

717
01:11:35,045 --> 01:11:37,631
You have had dozens of lives
before now.

718
01:11:37,714 --> 01:11:39,091
You happened to wake up...

719
01:11:39,132 --> 01:11:41,969
while I was imprinting you
with this one.

720
01:11:42,052 --> 01:11:43,971
Why are they doing all this?

721
01:11:44,096 --> 01:11:48,225
It is our capacity for
individuality, our souls...

722
01:11:48,267 --> 01:11:50,102
that makes us different
from them.

723
01:11:50,102 --> 01:11:52,604
They think they'll find
the human soul...

724
01:11:52,604 --> 01:11:55,315
if they understand
how our memories work.

725
01:11:55,315 --> 01:11:59,820
They have collective memories.
They share one group mind.

726
01:11:59,862 --> 01:12:04,741
They're dying. Their race is
on the brink of extinction.

727
01:12:04,783 --> 01:12:07,786
-They think we can save them.
-Where do I fit in?

728
01:12:07,828 --> 01:12:12,332
You're different. You resisted
my attempt to imprint you.

729
01:12:17,254 --> 01:12:20,757
Somehow, you have developed
their ability to Tune.

730
01:12:20,757 --> 01:12:24,011
That is how they change things,
how they built this city.

731
01:12:24,094 --> 01:12:26,972
They have machines buried
beneath the surface...

732
01:12:26,972 --> 01:12:30,517
that allow them to focus
their telepathic energies.

733
01:12:31,310 --> 01:12:33,937
They control everything here,
even the sun.

734
01:12:33,979 --> 01:12:37,149
That's why it's always dark.
They can't stand the light.

735
01:12:37,191 --> 01:12:38,650
Why do they need you?

736
01:12:38,692 --> 01:12:40,652
When they first brought us here,

737
01:12:40,652 --> 01:12:44,990
they extracted what was in us
and stored the information,

738
01:12:45,032 --> 01:12:46,950
remixed it like paint...

739
01:12:46,992 --> 01:12:49,494
and gave us back
new memories of their choosing.

740
01:12:49,536 --> 01:12:53,123
But they still needed an artist
to help them.

741
01:12:54,875 --> 01:12:59,838
I understood the human mind
better than they ever could,

742
01:12:59,880 --> 01:13:03,509
so they allowed me to keep
my skills as a scientist...

743
01:13:03,509 --> 01:13:05,010
because they needed them.

744
01:13:05,010 --> 01:13:07,471
They made me delete
everything else.

745
01:13:16,063 --> 01:13:20,526
Can you imagine what it's like
to erase your own past?

746
01:13:20,567 --> 01:13:23,820
What about my past?
What about my childhood?

747
01:13:24,696 --> 01:13:26,782
Shell Beach. Uncle Karl.

748
01:13:27,991 --> 01:13:32,079
What about this?
This was blank when I found it.

749
01:13:32,120 --> 01:13:35,958
You still don't understand.
You were never a boy.

750
01:13:35,999 --> 01:13:37,334
Not in this place.

751
01:13:37,334 --> 01:13:40,212
Your history is an illusion,
a fabrication,

752
01:13:40,254 --> 01:13:42,089
as it is with all of us.

753
01:13:42,172 --> 01:13:44,675
You made those drawings happen
with your gift.

754
01:13:44,675 --> 01:13:46,218
You say they brought us here.

755
01:13:48,554 --> 01:13:49,555
From where?

756
01:13:53,433 --> 01:13:56,603
I'm sorry. I don't remember.

757
01:13:57,437 --> 01:14:01,692
None of us remember that...
what we once were...

758
01:14:01,733 --> 01:14:05,279
what we might have been...
somewhere else.

759
01:14:23,046 --> 01:14:26,800
I've taken you this far.
You don't need me anymore.

760
01:14:26,884 --> 01:14:27,801
Let's go.

761
01:15:13,263 --> 01:15:15,474
There is no ocean, John.

762
01:15:16,808 --> 01:15:18,936
There's nothing beyond the city.

763
01:15:20,521 --> 01:15:23,023
The only place home exists...

764
01:15:25,275 --> 01:15:26,860
is in your head.

765
01:15:38,288 --> 01:15:39,289
Stop!

766
01:15:52,344 --> 01:15:53,345
Please!

767
01:16:14,241 --> 01:16:16,368
Now you know the truth.

768
01:17:15,928 --> 01:17:18,597
You'll allow yourself
to surrender...

769
01:17:18,597 --> 01:17:20,933
or it will result in
this one's death.

770
01:17:20,933 --> 01:17:22,142
What do I care?

771
01:17:22,643 --> 01:17:24,728
She's not my real wife.
She's nothing to me.

772
01:17:24,770 --> 01:17:29,441
But you do still care,
don't you, Mr. Murdoch?

773
01:17:29,483 --> 01:17:33,737
I have become the monster
you were intended to be.

774
01:17:35,697 --> 01:17:39,243
Shall I end her life now,
as you would have?

775
01:17:42,788 --> 01:17:48,126
-Don't hurt her, please.
-Then surrender.

776
01:17:50,295 --> 01:17:51,296
Sleep.

777
01:17:53,423 --> 01:17:54,341
Now.

778
01:18:13,694 --> 01:18:14,695
Sleep.

779
01:18:23,745 --> 01:18:25,122
Kill him.

780
01:18:25,163 --> 01:18:26,164
Kill him !

781
01:18:36,675 --> 01:18:40,179
He is powerful, yes, dangerous.

782
01:18:40,179 --> 01:18:43,515
But he can also lead us
to what we seek...

783
01:18:43,557 --> 01:18:46,727
what the doctor calls the soul.

784
01:18:46,810 --> 01:18:50,731
It is time for our experiment
to move into a final phase.

785
01:18:50,814 --> 01:18:53,609
We no longer need
the other subjects.

786
01:18:53,650 --> 01:18:57,029
The time for study is over.

787
01:18:57,029 --> 01:19:01,366
It is time to be one
with John Murdoch.

788
01:19:08,207 --> 01:19:11,543
It is time, Doctor. Imprint.

789
01:19:14,213 --> 01:19:16,381
Shut it down!

790
01:19:17,299 --> 01:19:19,718
Shut it down forever.

791
01:19:34,358 --> 01:19:35,442
What are you doing?

792
01:19:36,360 --> 01:19:41,073
They want to imprint you with
their own collective memories.

793
01:19:42,157 --> 01:19:44,368
They want to make you
one of them...

794
01:19:44,409 --> 01:19:46,578
so they can share your soul.

795
01:19:46,620 --> 01:19:48,956
But I've got other plans.

796
01:19:52,334 --> 01:19:55,254
Imprint, Doctor.
No more disobedience.

797
01:19:55,254 --> 01:19:59,883
I'm sorry. The pain will
only last a moment.

798
01:20:10,978 --> 01:20:12,729
Remember, John.

799
01:20:13,730 --> 01:20:15,774
You'll rise to greater heights
than that.

800
01:20:15,816 --> 01:20:18,277
One day when you're older,
you'll understand.

801
01:20:19,611 --> 01:20:20,571
Remember.

802
01:20:21,947 --> 01:20:24,783
That's it, John.
Practice makes perfect.

803
01:20:24,825 --> 01:20:28,078
Now, remember what I told you.
Never talk to strangers.

804
01:20:28,453 --> 01:20:29,788
John, remember.

805
01:20:29,997 --> 01:20:32,791
You're probably wondering why I
keep appearing in your memories.

806
01:20:32,833 --> 01:20:35,294
It's because I have
inserted myself in them.

807
01:20:35,294 --> 01:20:39,298
They were fabricated to
teach you about the Strangers.

808
01:20:39,298 --> 01:20:42,467
Give you a lifetime of knowledge
in a single syringe.

809
01:20:45,262 --> 01:20:49,933
You will survive, John. You'll
find strength within yourself.

810
01:20:49,975 --> 01:20:51,518
And you will prevail.

811
01:20:52,186 --> 01:20:53,312
Remember.

812
01:20:54,021 --> 01:20:56,273
-Hi, Uncle Karl.
-Johnny!

813
01:20:59,193 --> 01:21:03,322
Getting the hang of it, John.
Maybe one day I'll work for you.

814
01:21:03,947 --> 01:21:07,576
Here's the machine the Strangers
use to amplify their thoughts,

815
01:21:07,618 --> 01:21:09,369
the machine that changes
their world.

816
01:21:09,411 --> 01:21:12,664
You must take control of it.
You must make the machine yours.

817
01:21:12,706 --> 01:21:17,336
I know you can beat them,
but you must concentrate.

818
01:21:19,338 --> 01:21:20,547
Something's wrong.

819
01:21:29,348 --> 01:21:31,183
There is no time for romance.

820
01:21:31,225 --> 01:21:33,352
The world can be
what you make it.

821
01:21:34,353 --> 01:21:35,395
What have you done?

822
01:21:36,522 --> 01:21:38,649
You have the power
to make anything happen...

823
01:21:38,732 --> 01:21:40,651
but you must act now.

824
01:26:24,977 --> 01:26:29,189
I knew you could do it, John.
You have their power now.

825
01:26:29,273 --> 01:26:31,525
-You control their machines.
-Where's Emma?

826
01:26:32,693 --> 01:26:37,155
She's not Emma anymore.
She has been reimprinted.

827
01:26:37,155 --> 01:26:39,449
-So give her back her memories.
-I can't.

828
01:26:39,491 --> 01:26:43,579
The facility where they stored
the memories has been destroyed.

829
01:26:44,371 --> 01:26:45,372
I'm sorry.

830
01:26:46,790 --> 01:26:48,750
What are you going to do now?

831
01:26:51,753 --> 01:26:53,255
I'm gonna fix things.

832
01:26:54,882 --> 01:26:58,218
You told me I had the power,
didn't you?

833
01:26:59,178 --> 01:27:02,097
I can make these machines
do anything I want.

834
01:27:03,182 --> 01:27:05,225
Make this world
anything I want it to be.

835
01:27:06,435 --> 01:27:10,480
Just so long as I concentrate
hard enough.

836
01:28:34,189 --> 01:28:35,399
Where are you going?

837
01:28:38,861 --> 01:28:39,862
Shell Beach.

838
01:29:21,236 --> 01:29:22,738
-What's the fare?
-A quarter.

839
01:29:29,494 --> 01:29:31,246
-Please.
-Oh, no, sit.

840
01:29:32,539 --> 01:29:33,540
Thank you.

841
01:30:19,545 --> 01:30:21,547
Been waiting for you, yes?

842
01:30:22,214 --> 01:30:26,552
-What are you doing?
-I'm just making a few changes.

843
01:30:26,593 --> 01:30:31,473
-We're sure that's what we want?
-I'll take my chances.

844
01:30:31,557 --> 01:30:37,312
I'm dying, John. Your imprint
is not agreeable with my kind.

845
01:30:37,396 --> 01:30:39,565
But I wanted to know
what it was like.

846
01:30:41,275 --> 01:30:42,860
How you feel.

847
01:30:42,985 --> 01:30:45,612
You know how I was
supposed to feel.

848
01:30:45,654 --> 01:30:49,741
That person isn't me.
Never was.

849
01:30:49,783 --> 01:30:52,995
You wanted to know what it was
that makes us human.

850
01:30:54,079 --> 01:30:57,875
Well, you're not going to
find it in here.

851
01:30:59,501 --> 01:31:01,295
You went looking
in the wrong place.

852
01:32:40,561 --> 01:32:42,354
It's so beautiful here.

853
01:32:47,818 --> 01:32:49,069
So bright.

854
01:32:55,325 --> 01:32:57,369
Do you know if Shell Beach
is around here?

855
01:32:58,120 --> 01:33:00,497
I think that's it over there.

856
01:33:18,765 --> 01:33:20,767
I'm headed that way myself.

857
01:33:22,769 --> 01:33:24,104
Would you like to join me?

858
01:33:27,274 --> 01:33:28,233
Sure.

859
01:33:33,697 --> 01:33:37,201
I'm Anna, by the way.
What's your name?
